result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

2:00PM (64-06)Defendant Suzanne B Pierce in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Suzanne B Pierce. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Venema acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges.

Attorney Venema is requesting a Status Hearing in August.

Clerk of Courts to reassign case to a specific Judge, so a Status Hearing can be set in August.

Adj. 2:02PM

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court with attorney Keith Venema. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Atty Venema appointed yesterday. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Follow all CPS Requirements, follow all family Court orders. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Suzanne B Pierce in court, in custody by video. Attorney Uzowulu appeared for bond purposes only. Defendant referred to SPD. New bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Follow all CPS Requirements, follow all family Court orders. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
